meanings.definition: Synchronize: to cause to occur or operate at the same time or rate
meanings.sent1: The music in the dance performance syncs perfectly with the movements of the dancers.
meanings.sent2: The traffic lights syncs to ensure a smooth flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The chef's cooking skills syncs with the precision of a watchmaker.
meanings.sent4: Her heart syncs with the rhythm of the ocean waves, calm and steady.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers' movements syncs beautifully with the music, creating a mesmerizing performance.

meanings.definition: Synchronization: the act or process of synchronizing
meanings.sent1: The synchronization of the clocks was crucial for the experiment to proceed accurately.
meanings.sent2: The synchronization of the team members' efforts led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent3: The synchronization of the dancers' steps brought a smile to the audience's faces.
meanings.sent4: The synchronization of the gears in the machine was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The synchronization of the traffic lights kept the traffic flowing smoothly through the intersection.

meanings.definition: Synchronized: happening at the same time or rate
meanings.sent1: The synchronized clapping of the audience showed their appreciation for the performance.
meanings.sent2: The synchronized movements of the athletes impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized blinking of the fireflies in the night sky was a magical sight.
meanings.sent4: The synchronized beating of their hearts echoed in the silent room.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized breathing of the yoga class created a sense of unity among the participants.
